verses.verse: At the <S%H7093>end<s%> of every <S%H7651>seven<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> thou shalt <S%H6213>make<s%> a <S%H8059>release<s%>.

And this is the <S%H1697>manner<s%> of the <S%H8059>release<s%>: Every <S%H1167>creditor<s%> <S%H4874><s%> <S%H3027><s%> that <S%H5383>lendeth<s%> ought unto his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%> shall <S%H8058>release<s%> it; he shall not <S%H5065>exact<s%> it of his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%>, or of his <S%H251>brother<s%>; because it is <S%H7121>called<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD'S<s%> <S%H8059>release<s%>. creditor: Heb. master of the lending of his hand
Of a <S%H5237>foreigner<s%> thou mayest <S%H5065>exact<s%> it again: but that which is thine with thy <S%H251>brother<s%> thine <S%H3027>hand<s%> shall <S%H8058>release<s%>;

<S%H657>Save<s%> when there shall be no <S%H34>poor<s%> among you; for the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall <S%H1288>greatly<s%> <S%H1288>bless<s%> thee in the <S%H776>land<s%> which the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> thee for an <S%H5159>inheritance<s%> to <S%H3423>possess<s%> it: Save: or, To the end that there be no poor among you

Only if thou <S%H8085>carefully<s%> <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>, to <S%H8104>observe<s%> to <S%H6213>do<s%> all these <S%H4687>commandments<s%> which I <S%H6680>command<s%> thee this <S%H3117>day<s%>.

For the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H1288>blesseth<s%> thee, as he <S%H1696>promised<s%> thee: and thou shalt <S%H5670>lend<s%> unto <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H1471>nations<s%>, but thou shalt not <S%H5670>borrow<s%>; and thou shalt <S%H4910>reign<s%> over <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H1471>nations<s%>, but they shall not <S%H4910>reign<s%> over thee.

If there be among you a poor <S%H34>man<s%> of <S%H259>one<s%> of thy <S%H251>brethren<s%> within <S%H259>any<s%> of thy <S%H8179>gates<s%> in thy <S%H776>land<s%> which the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> thee, thou shalt not <S%H553>harden<s%> thine <S%H3824>heart<s%>, nor <S%H7092>shut<s%> thine <S%H3027>hand<s%> from thy <S%H34>poor<s%> <S%H251>brother<s%>:

But thou shalt <S%H6605>open<s%> thine <S%H3027>hand<s%> <S%H6605>wide<s%> unto him, and shalt <S%H5670>surely<s%> <S%H5670>lend<s%> him <S%H1767>sufficient<s%> for his <S%H4270>need<s%>, in that which he <S%H2637>wanteth<s%>.

<S%H8104>Beware<s%> that there be not a <S%H1697>thought<s%> in thy <S%H1100>wicked<s%> <S%H3824>heart<s%>, <S%H559>saying<s%>, The <S%H7651>seventh<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%>, the <S%H8141>year<s%> of <S%H8059>release<s%>, is at <S%H7126>hand<s%>; and thine <S%H5869>eye<s%> be <S%H7489>evil<s%> against thy <S%H34>poor<s%> <S%H251>brother<s%>, and thou <S%H5414>givest<s%> him nought; and he <S%H7121>cry<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> against thee, and it be <S%H2399>sin<s%> unto thee. thought: Heb. word wicked: Heb. Belial

Thou shalt <S%H5414>surely<s%> <S%H5414>give<s%> him, and thine <S%H3824>heart<s%> shall not be <S%H3415>grieved<s%> when thou <S%H5414>givest<s%> unto him: <S%H1558>because<s%> that for this <S%H1697>thing<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> shall <S%H1288>bless<s%> thee in all thy <S%H4639>works<s%>, and in all that thou <S%H4916>puttest<s%> thine <S%H3027>hand<s%> unto.

For the <S%H34>poor<s%> shall never <S%H2308>cease<s%> out <S%H7130>of<s%> the <S%H776>land<s%>: therefore I <S%H6680>command<s%> thee, <S%H559>saying<s%>, Thou shalt <S%H6605>open<s%> thine <S%H3027>hand<s%> <S%H6605>wide<s%> unto thy <S%H251>brother<s%>, to thy <S%H6041>poor<s%>, and to thy <S%H34>needy<s%>, in thy <S%H776>land<s%>.

And if thy <S%H251>brother<s%>, an Hebrew <S%H5680>man<s%>, or an Hebrew <S%H5680>woman<s%>, be <S%H4376>sold<s%> unto thee, and <S%H5647>serve<s%> thee <S%H8337>six<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>; then in the <S%H7637>seventh<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%> thou shalt let him <S%H7971>go<s%> <S%H2670>free<s%> from thee.
And when thou <S%H7971>sendest<s%> him out <S%H2670>free<s%> from thee, thou shalt not let him go <S%H7971>away<s%> <S%H7387>empty<s%>:

Thou shalt <S%H6059>furnish<s%> him <S%H6059>liberally<s%> out of thy <S%H6629>flock<s%>, and out of thy <S%H1637>floor<s%>, and out of thy <S%H3342>winepress<s%>: of that wherewith the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> hath <S%H1288>blessed<s%> thee thou shalt <S%H5414>give<s%> unto him.

And thou shalt <S%H2142>remember<s%> that thou wast a <S%H5650>bondman<s%> in the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>, and the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H6299>redeemed<s%> thee: therefore I <S%H6680>command<s%> thee this <S%H1697>thing<s%> to <S%H3117>day<s%>.

And it shall be, if he <S%H559>say<s%> unto thee, I will not go <S%H3318>away<s%> from thee; because he <S%H157>loveth<s%> thee and thine <S%H1004>house<s%>, because he is <S%H2895>well<s%> with thee;

Then thou shalt <S%H3947>take<s%> an <S%H4836>aul<s%>, and <S%H5414>thrust<s%> it through his <S%H241>ear<s%> unto the <S%H1817>door<s%>, and he shall be thy <S%H5650>servant<s%> for <S%H5769>ever<s%>. And also unto thy <S%H519>maidservant<s%> thou shalt <S%H6213>do<s%> likewise.

It shall not seem <S%H7185>hard<s%> unto <S%H5869>thee<s%>, when thou sendest him <S%H7971>away<s%> <S%H2670>free<s%> from thee; for he hath been <S%H7939>worth<s%> a <S%H4932>double<s%> hired <S%H7916>servant<s%> to thee, in <S%H5647>serving<s%> thee <S%H8337>six<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>: and the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> shall <S%H1288>bless<s%> thee in all that thou <S%H6213>doest<s%>.

All the <S%H1060>firstling<s%> <S%H2145>males<s%> that <S%H3205>come<s%> of thy <S%H1241>herd<s%> and of thy <S%H6629>flock<s%> thou shalt <S%H6942>sanctify<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>: thou shalt do no <S%H5647>work<s%> with the <S%H1060>firstling<s%> of thy <S%H7794>bullock<s%>, nor <S%H1494>shear<s%> the <S%H1060>firstling<s%> of thy <S%H6629>sheep<s%>.

Thou shalt <S%H398>eat<s%> it <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%> by <S%H8141>year<s%> in the <S%H4725>place<s%> which the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall <S%H977>choose<s%>, thou and thy <S%H1004>household<s%>.

And if there be any <S%H3971>blemish<s%> therein, as if it be <S%H6455>lame<s%>, or <S%H5787>blind<s%>, or have any <S%H7451>ill<s%> <S%H3971>blemish<s%>, thou shalt not <S%H2076>sacrifice<s%> it unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>.

Thou shalt <S%H398>eat<s%> it within thy <S%H8179>gates<s%>: the <S%H2931>unclean<s%> and the <S%H2889>clean<s%> person shall eat it <S%H3162>alike<s%>, as the <S%H6643>roebuck<s%>, and as the <S%H354>hart<s%>.
Only thou shalt not <S%H398>eat<s%> the <S%H1818>blood<s%> thereof; thou shalt <S%H8210>pour<s%> it upon the <S%H776>ground<s%> as <S%H4325>water<s%>.
